alert.note: Alert for Carter; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Garvin, Grady, Stephens, northwestern Carter and McClain Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 151 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Pocasset to near Agawam to 4 miles northeast of Comanche. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Duncan, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Marlow, Lindsay, Goldsby, Maysville, Rush Springs, Bray, Dibble, Elmore City, Velma, Washington, Cole, Alex, Verden, Amber and Katie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 81 and 89. Interstate 44 between mile markers 69 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
